page.title: 11ATTITUDES TO STUDY CENTRE
page.content: Stibbington Field Studies Centre was set up more than twenty years ago by the Headmaster of the former village school using surplus accommodation on the school site. In 1982 when the village school closed the field centre took over all of the buildings whilst village children travelled to nearby Elton to school. This led to some considerable discontent amongst villagers who resented the fact that their children were no longer able to attend school in their own village. Today attitudes to the field centre are varied: some local people are still hostile towards it and some complain that the visiting children have trespassed onto their land, but on the whole a good relationship exists, with many local people supporting the need for town children to come to the countryside.
